content:
Biography Dr. Aditya Rastogi is a postdoctoral researcher in the Department of Neuroradiology at Universit√§tsklinikum Bonn, where he works with Prof. Philipp Vollmuth and leads AI research within the Division of Computational Radiology and Clinical AI. His research focuses on developing advanced computational methods for medical image reconstruction, solving inverse problems, and integrating multi-modal neuroimaging.
His current research interests lie in designing AI algorithms for ultra-low-field MRI and MRI scan-time reduction with a focus on generative modelling and human-in-the-loop optimisation. He earned his M.Tech and Ph.D. from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore, under the supervision of Prof. Phaneendra Yalavarthy, with a specialisation in computational medical imaging. During his doctoral studies, he was awarded the prestigious Prime Minister‚Äôs Research Fellowship (PMRF) by the Government of India in recognition of his research potential.
Prior to joining Universit√§tsklinikum Bonn, he held a postdoctoral position at Universit√§tsklinikum Heidelberg. He is also engaged in mentoring graduate students and contributing to open-source initiatives in medical AI.
summary: Biography Dr. Aditya Rastogi is a postdoctoral researcher in the Department of Neuroradiology at Universit√§tsklinikum Bonn, where he works with Prof. Philipp Vollmuth and leads AI research within the Division of Computational Radiology and Clinical AI.
title: Aditya Rastogi

content: Biography Bareen Haval holds a master degree in Artificial Inelegance and she has been a lecturer at the IT departments teaching AI. Currently, Bareen is perusing her PhD in AI at Duhok Polytechnic University. Mrs. Bareen is the head of cooperation and coordination at the international relations office, she leads efforts to establish and maintain partnerships with international higher education institutions. Responsibilities include preparing and negotiating MoUs, writing proposals for external funding, and managing international collaborations. Identifying global opportunities, coordinating exchange programs, and facilitating joint research projects. She ensures the successful implementation of agreements and she has been part of many projects that were funded by the European Union, DAAD and UNISCO funded projects.
summary: Biography Bareen Haval holds a master degree in Artificial Inelegance and she has been a lecturer at the IT departments teaching AI. Currently, Bareen is perusing her PhD in AI at Duhok Polytechnic University.
title: Bareen Haval

content: Biography David is currently pursuing his PhD at the University Hospital Bonn, under the guidance of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. With a background in engineering and informatics, he completed his interuniversity master‚Äôs degree in AI in 2022 from the Facultat d‚ÄôInform√†tica de Barcelona (FIB), which is a joint program of Universitat Polit√®cnica de Catalunya, Universitat de Barcelona, and Universitat Rovira i Virgili. With over two years of industry experience in software development, David secured the first position in the live SIIM-ISIC 2019 competition for skin lesion classification and published a full paper at the International Conference VISAPP 2023. His goal is to leverage his skills and knowledge to make valuable contributions to the field of AI in medicine at the Albarqouni Lab.
summary: Biography David is currently pursuing his PhD at the University Hospital Bonn, under the guidance of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. With a background in engineering and informatics, he completed his interuniversity master‚Äôs degree in AI in 2022 from the Facultat d‚ÄôInform√†tica de Barcelona (FIB), which is a joint program of Universitat Polit√®cnica de Catalunya, Universitat de Barcelona, and Universitat Rovira i Virgili.
title: David D. Gaviria

content: Biography Diletta is currently pursuing her PhD at the M.O.D.A.L. research group @University of Naples Federico II, under the supervision of Prof. Francesco Piccialli, the lab‚Äôs head and scientific director. She holds a master‚Äôs degree in Statistical Sciences, completed in 2021 from the same university. With over two years of research experience, particularly in Federated Learning, and collaborations with industries on AI models for Industry and Education 4.0, Diletta aims to leverage her expertise to address open issues in Federated Learning, such as solving statistical and device heterogeneity, making significant contributions to this field of AI.
summary: Biography Diletta is currently pursuing her PhD at the M.O.D.A.L. research group @University of Naples Federico II, under the supervision of Prof. Francesco Piccialli, the lab‚Äôs head and scientific director. She holds a master‚Äôs degree in Statistical Sciences, completed in 2021 from the same university.
title: Diletta Chiaro

content:
Biography Elodie is in the last year of her PhD at the University of Rennes, under the supervision of Dr. Camille Maumet from the Empenn research team and Prof. Elisa Fromont from the LACODAM research team. After four years of medicine school at the University of Versailles, she took a shift in her career and started a Master‚Äôs degree in bioinformatics at the University of Rennes.
Her research focuses on exploring and modelling analytical variability in functional MRI data analyses, particularly using deep representation learning. Her goal is to facilitate the re-use of data shared on public databases by taking into account the different sources of variability. In the future, she would like to focus more in the use of real-world data and on the robustness of machine learning models to privacy attacks.
summary: Biography Elodie is in the last year of her PhD at the University of Rennes, under the supervision of Dr. Camille Maumet from the Empenn research team and Prof. Elisa Fromont from the LACODAM research team.
title: Elodie Germani

content: Biography Elyes is a Master‚Äôs student in Computer Science at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. His current research focuses on generative modeling, which he conducts at the Heidelberg Institute for Theoretical Studies as part of the Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (MLI) group. Previously, he completed his bachelor‚Äôs thesis on AI-based detection of inherited retinal diseases under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni.
summary: Biography Elyes is a Master‚Äôs student in Computer Science at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. His current research focuses on generative modeling, which he conducts at the Heidelberg Institute for Theoretical Studies as part of the Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (MLI) group.
title: Elyes Farjallah

content: Biography Hadil Affes recently graduated with a degree in Embedded Systems and Connected Objects Engineering from the Higher Institute of Computer Science (ISI) in Tunisia. She completed her graduation project during an internship at Octomiro, where she focused on MLOps and large vision models, with an emphasis on model benchmarking and scalable inference pipelines. Her work also involved fine-tuning vision foundation models such as SAM and DINOv2 using LoRA for domain-specific tasks like industrial object counting. Previously, she contributed to a bioinformatics project at Talan that used retrieval-based techniques to predict stem cell differentiation from DNA sequences. She has also worked on deep learning projects involving CNNs and LLM-based chatbots, and is passionate about building domain-adapted AI solutions.
summary: Biography Hadil Affes recently graduated with a degree in Embedded Systems and Connected Objects Engineering from the Higher Institute of Computer Science (ISI) in Tunisia. She completed her graduation project during an internship at Octomiro, where she focused on MLOps and large vision models, with an emphasis on model benchmarking and scalable inference pipelines.
title: Hadil Affes

content: Biography Dr. Hussein Hassan is a full professor of Food Science & Technology, and director of Academic Compliance in the Provost‚Äôs Office at LAU. He served as the chairperson of the Department of Natural Sciences from 2018 to 2020. Dr. Hassan received his BSc and MSc in Food Technology from the American University of Beirut, Lebanon, and his PhD in Food Process Engineering from McGill University, Canada. He received the Research Excellence Award and the Teaching Excellence Awards at LAU in 2023 and 2024, respectively. Dr. Hassan‚Äôs research interests revolve around the area of non-microbial food safety, food processing, and food waste. His research has been published and presented so far in more than 150 international journals and scientific meetings. In addition, Dr. Hassan is a senior expert in multiple local and international organizations.
summary: Biography Dr. Hussein Hassan is a full professor of Food Science & Technology, and director of Academic Compliance in the Provost‚Äôs Office at LAU. He served as the chairperson of the Department of Natural Sciences from 2018 to 2020.
title: Hussein Hassan

content: Biography Islem Rekik is the Director of the Brain And SIgnal Research and Analysis (BASIRA) laboratory and an Associate Professor at Imperial College London (Innovation Hub I-X). She is the awardee of two prestigious international research fellowships (EU Marie Curie Fellowship & TUBITAK 2232). In 2025, she was the recipient of the prestigious Tunisian AI Award from the Tunisian AI Society (ùóßŒõùóúùó¶), recognizing Top AI Pioneers and was featured in the I-X news as well as the Realites magazine. Together with BASIRA members, she conducted more than 100 cutting-edge research projects cross-pollinating AI and healthcare ‚Äîwith a sharp focus on brain imaging and network neuroscience. UG and PG Students under her supervision received 24 highly competitive academic honors, grants and awards. She is also a co/chair/organizer of more than 34 international first-class conferences/workshops/competitions (e.g., Affordable AI 2021-22, Predictive AI 2018-2025, Machine Learning in Medical Imaging 2021-25, WILL competition 2021-23). She delivered 40+ invited keynotes, talks, seminars and lectures including prestigious international conferences (MICCAI, CVPR, ISBI, Wellcome trust). She is a member of the organizing committee of MICCAI 2023 (Vancouver), 2024 (Marrakesh) and South-Korea (2025). She will serve as the General Co-Chair of MICCAI 2026 in Abu Dhabi. In addition to her 160+ peer-reviewed publications in top journals including IEEE TPAMI (IF: 20.8) and BMJ (IF: 93), she is a strong advocate of equity, diversity and inclusiveness in AI and research. She is the former President of the Women in MICCAI (WiM), and the co-founder (and now former President) of the international RISE Network to Reinforce Inclusiveness & diverSity and Empower minority researchers in Low-Middle Income Countries (LMIC).
summary: Biography Islem Rekik is the Director of the Brain And SIgnal Research and Analysis (BASIRA) laboratory and an Associate Professor at Imperial College London (Innovation Hub I-X). She is the awardee of two prestigious international research fellowships (EU Marie Curie Fellowship & TUBITAK 2232).
title: Islem Rekik

content: Biography Merlin Engelke is a Data Scientist at the Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine, specializing in the development and deployment of machine learning algorithms in healthcare. He holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Industrial Engineering from the University of Duisburg-Essen, with a concentration in Mechatronics, and Business Informatics. Previously, Merlin worked as a Data Scientist at Campana & Schott GmbH, focusing on machine learning for business applications and leading cloud service projects. He is currently under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Felix Nensa. Merlin is skilled in C#, .NET Core, SQL Server, Python, Azure DevOps, and Docker, and holds several Azure certifications.
summary: Biography Merlin Engelke is a Data Scientist at the Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine, specializing in the development and deployment of machine learning algorithms in healthcare. He holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Industrial Engineering from the University of Duisburg-Essen, with a concentration in Mechatronics, and Business Informatics.
title: Merlin Engelke

content:
Biography Professor Moez Chafra, President of the University of Tunis El Manar since 2020, has led a sweeping modernization of the institution, implementing streamlined governance structures, attaining ISO 9001 certification, and overseeing a comprehensive digital transformation of academic and administrative services. He championed a campus-wide Green Ideas competition that mobilized students and faculty to develop sustainable solutions in energy, waste management, and biodiversity‚Äîreinforcing UTM‚Äôs commitment to environmental stewardship and community engagement.
An accomplished engineer and researcher, Prof. Chafra directs the Applied Mechanics and Systems Research Laboratory (LASMAP), where he advances cutting-edge work in hard coatings (CrAlN films), micro- and nano-systems, and biomechanical modeling. With over 38 peer-reviewed publications and nearly 300 citations to his name, he has garnered international recognition and, in April 2024, led a high-level delegation to Macau University of Science and Technology to forge new exchange programs and joint research initiatives‚Äîfostering global partnerships that enhance UTM‚Äôs impact in engineering, environmental science, and emerging technologies.
summary: Biography Professor Moez Chafra, President of the University of Tunis El Manar since 2020, has led a sweeping modernization of the institution, implementing streamlined governance structures, attaining ISO 9001 certification, and overseeing a comprehensive digital transformation of academic and administrative services.
title: Moez Chafra

content: Biography Monia Najjar received the M.S degree in Electrical Engineering and Ph.D degree in communication systems (Optical Communication) from the Higher School of Engineering of Tunis. She joined the Higher Institute of Computer Sciences of Tunis El Manar (ISI), as Assistant Professor, in 2004. From 2013 until 2017 she was associate professor. In 2018 she became full Professor and director of Higher Institute of Computer Sciences of Tunis El Manar. She has been a reviewer for many international journals and conferences. Her main research interests are optic communications: Dynamic bandwidth allocation, passive optical devices, photonic crystal structures, encoders, optical memories, biosensors and WDM networks. She successfully tutored and co-tutored more than 10 PhD students. She has authored/co-authored more than 30 papers in journals and more than 40 conference contributions. She is a member of the Technical Program Committee of more than 10 conferences and general co-chair of GIIS 2020. She has attended many events and conferences as guest speaker.
summary: Biography Monia Najjar received the M.S degree in Electrical Engineering and Ph.D degree in communication systems (Optical Communication) from the Higher School of Engineering of Tunis. She joined the Higher Institute of Computer Sciences of Tunis El Manar (ISI), as Assistant Professor, in 2004.
title: Monia Najar

content: Biography Nassir Navab is a full professor and director of the Laboratories for Computer Aided Medical Procedures (CAMP: http://campar.in.tum.de) at Technical University of Munich (TUM). He is also the director of Medical Augmented Reality (http://www.medicalaugmentedreality.org/) summer school series. He is a Member of Academia Europaea and received the prestigious IEEE Technical Achievement Award in 2025, MICCAI Enduring Impact Award in 2021, and IEEE ISMAR Career Impact Award in October 2024. He received the IEEE ISMAR 10 Years Lasting Impact Award in 2015, the SMIT Technology Innovation Award in 2010, and the prestigious Siemens Inventor of the Year Award in 2001. He has been recently honored as Medical AR Pioneer since 1997 in AWE XR hall of fame (https://www.awexr.com/hall-of-fame). He is also recognized for his pioneering work on digital surgical workflow modeling and representation starting in 2005 and on robotic imaging starting in 2012. He and his students have received many best paper awards including 16 awards at the prestigious MICCAI events, 9 at IPCAI, 2 at IPMI and 4 at IEEE ISMAR. He is Fellow of the MICCAI Society and acted on its board of directors from 2007 to 2012 and from 2014 to 2017. He is also an ELLIS Fellow, IEEE Fellow, Fellow of International Academy of Medical and Biological Engineering (IAMBE), and Fellow of Asia-Pacific Artificial Intelligence Association (AAIA). He is the author of hundreds of peer reviewed scientific papers and over 100 granted US and international patents. As of June 2025, his papers have received over 92000 citations and enjoy an h-index of 130.
summary: Biography Nassir Navab is a full professor and director of the Laboratories for Computer Aided Medical Procedures (CAMP: http://campar.in.tum.de) at Technical University of Munich (TUM). He is also the director of Medical Augmented Reality (http://www.
title: Nsssir Navab

content:
Biography Rached Abdelkhalek is a Sr. Solutions Architect at NVIDIA with a background in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallel computing. At NVIDIA, his work focuses on leveraging NVIDIA ecosystem to create innovative solutions in the fields of medical imaging, genomics, and drug discovery.
Prior to joining NVIDIA, Rached held positions as a research scientist at the Extreme Computing Research Center at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) and as an HPC software developer at TOTAL Energies. At KAUST, Rached worked on developing parallel algorithms and software for HPC systems, while at TOTAL Energies, he specialized in developing and optimizing scientific software for seismic imaging and interpretation.
Rached holds a Ph.D. in computer science from the University of Bordeaux I, where he conducted research on parallel algorithms for HPC systems. He also holds an engineering degree in computer science from Bordeaux Institute of Technology.
summary: Biography Rached Abdelkhalek is a Sr. Solutions Architect at NVIDIA with a background in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallel computing. At NVIDIA, his work focuses on leveraging NVIDIA ecosystem to create innovative solutions in the fields of medical imaging, genomics, and drug discovery.
title: Rached Abdelkhalak

content: Biography
summary: Biography
title: Sara Alrawi

content:
Shadi Albarqouni is a Palestinian-German Professor of Computational Medical Imaging Research. He received his B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from the IU Gaza, Palestine, in 2005, and 2010, respectively. In 2012, he received the DAAD research grant to pursue his Ph.D. at the Chair for Computer Aided Medical Procedures (CAMP), Technical University of Munich (TUM), Germany. During his Ph.D., Albarqouni worked with Prof. Nassir Navab on developing machine learning algorithms to handle noisy labels, coming from crowdsourcing, in medical imaging. His AggNet paper, published at the Special Issue on Deep Learning at the IEEE Transaction on Medcial Imaging (IF: 10.048), was among the first ones on Medical Imaging with Deep Learning and has been featured as the top downloaded article for a couple of years at IEEEXplore.
Right before he received his Ph.D. in Computer Science with summa cum laude in 2017, Albarqouni worked as a Senior Research Scientist & Team Lead at CAMP leading the Medical Image Analysis (MedIA). Together with his team addressed the common challenges concern the nature of medical data, namely heterogeneity, severe class-imbalance, few amounts of annotated data, inter-/intra-scanners variability (domain shift), inter-/intra-observer disagreement (noisy annotations). In 2019, Albarqouni received the prestigious P.R.I.M.E. fellowship for a one-year international mobility, where he worked as a Visiting Scientist at the Department of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering (D-ITET) at ETH Z√ºrich, Switzerland. He worked with Prof. Ender Konukoglu on Modeling Uncertainty in Medical Imaging, in particular, the one associated with inter-/intra-raters variability. Afterwards, Albarqouni worked as a Visting Scientist with Prof. Daniel Rueckert at the Department of Computing at Imperial College London, United Kingdom.
Since Nov. 2020, Albarqouni has been appointed as an AI Young Investigator Group Leader at Helmholtz AI. The aim of Albarqouni‚Äôs Lab. is to develop innovative deep Federated Learning algorithms that can distill and share the knowledge among AI agents in a robust and privacy-preserved fashion. Since Jan. 2022, Albarqouni has been appointed as a W2 Professor of Computational Medical Imaging Research at the Faculty of Medicine, University of Bonn.
Albarqouni has more than 100 peer-reviewed publications in both Medical Imaging Computing and Computer Vision published in high impacted journals and top-tier conferences. He serves as a reviewer for many journals, e.g., IEEE TPAMI, MedIA, IEEE TMI, IEEE JBHI, IJCARS and Pattern Recognition, and top-tier conferences, e.g., ECCV, MICCAI, MIDL, BMVC, IPCAI, and ISBI among others. He is also an active member of MICCAI, BMVA, IEEE EMBS, IEEE CS, and ESR society. Recently, Albarqouni has been elected as a member for the European Lab for Learning and Intelligent Systems (ELLIS), the Arab German Young Academy (AGYA), Global Young Academy (GYA), and the Higher Council for Innovation and Excellence‚Äé in Diaspora (HCIE). Since 2015, he has been serving as a PC member for a couple of MICCAI workshops, e.g., COMPAY, DART, DCL, FAIR among others. Since 2019, Albarqouni has been serving as an Area Chair in Advance Machine Learning Theory at MICCAI. Recently, he has been serving as a Program Co-Chair at MIDL'22 in Swizterland, and as an Organizing Committee Member at ISBI'22 in India, MICCAI'24 in Morocco.
His current research interests include Interpretable ML, Robustness, Uncertainty, and Federated Learning. He is also interested in Entrepreneurship and Startups for Innovative Medical Solutions with limited resources.
summary: Shadi Albarqouni is a Palestinian-German Professor of Computational Medical Imaging Research. He received his B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from the IU Gaza, Palestine, in 2005, and 2010, respectively. In 2012, he received the DAAD research grant to pursue his Ph.
title: Shadi Albarqouni

content: Biography Vasileios Belagiannis is Professor at the Faculty of Engineering of the Friedrich-Alexander-Universit√§t Erlangen-N√ºrnberg. He holds a degree in engineering (Greece, 2009) from Democritus University of Thrace, Engineering School of Xanthi and M.Sc. in Computational Science and Engineering from TU M√ºnchen (Germany, 2011). He completed his doctoral studies at TU M√ºnchen (2015) and then continued as post-doctoral research assistant at the University of Oxford (Visual Geometry Group). Prior to joining Friedrich-Alexander-Universit√§t Erlangen-N√ºrnberg, he spent time in industry, working at OSRAM, and then Ulm University and Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg
summary: Biography Vasileios Belagiannis is Professor at the Faculty of Engineering of the Friedrich-Alexander-Universit√§t Erlangen-N√ºrnberg. He holds a degree in engineering (Greece, 2009) from Democritus University of Thrace, Engineering School of Xanthi and M.
title: Vasileios Belagiannis

content:
Biography Zahra is a Master‚Äôs student in Computer Science at the University of Bonn, specializing in intelligent systems and computer vision. Her thesis, supervised by Prof. Dr. Reinhard Klein and Dr. Moritz Wolter, is conducted in collaboration with the HPC/A Lab and the University Hospital Bonn, and focuses on automating MRI brain protocol selection using machine learning.
She also works as a Graduate Research Assistant at the HPC/A Lab, where she supports machine learning projects, assists in teaching advanced ML and C++/CUDA programming courses, and contributes to course development. Her interests include deep learning for NLP and computer vision, with hands-on experience in fine-tuning large models such as LLMs and vision transformers, particularly in medical applications.
summary: Biography Zahra is a Master‚Äôs student in Computer Science at the University of Bonn, specializing in intelligent systems and computer vision. Her thesis, supervised by Prof. Dr. Reinhard Klein and Dr.
title: Zahra Ganji

content:
Slides can be added in a few ways:
Create slides using Wowchemy‚Äôs Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.
summary: An example event.
title: Example Event
